measured_by: lambda (−L / G) parameter derived from logistic regression of accept-reject choices for 64 lotteries
justification: “The degree of loss aversion of each participant is then operationalized as λ = − L / G,” where L and G are coefficients estimated from a logistic regression on the lottery decisions.

measured_by: G coefficient from logistic regression on gain amounts in lottery decisions
justification: The paper notes that in the regression model “G reflects the utility of a unit increase in gains,” indicating that this coefficient is the operational measure of gain utility.

measured_by: L coefficient from logistic regression on loss amounts in lottery decisions
justification: The authors state that “L reflects the utility of a unit increase in losses,” showing that the regression coefficient L functions as the empirical measure of loss disutility.
